EXPERIMENT.center_name: Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology
EXPERIMENT.TITLE: MinION single-end Sequencing of raw single-cell cDNA library (SPLiT-seq) of NIH3T3_RAW_Jurkat without size selection

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: The Nanopore sequencing library was prepared from a single-cell cDNA library using the Ligation Sequencing Kit V9 (#SQK-LSK109, #EXP-NBD104, and #EXP-NBD114, Oxford Nanopore Technologies) following the manufactureru0026#39;s protocol. The sequencing library was then loaded to a MinION flow cell (R9.4.1) (#FLO-MIN106, Oxford Nanopore Technologies) and sequenced on the MinION Mk1B (Oxford Nanopore Technologies) with a sampling rate of 4 kHz. The raw sequencing output (FAST5) was basecalled with Guppy (version 6.5.7) using the u0026quot;SUPu0026quot; basecalling model (the most accurate and slowest) u0026quot;dna_r9.4.1_450bps_sup.cfgu0026quot;. The low-quality reads were filtered using the minimum quality score of 9.

EXPERIMENT.center_name: Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology
EXPERIMENT.TITLE: MinION single-end Sequencing of Ouro-Seq-applied single-cell cDNA library (SPLiT-seq) of NIH3T3_RAW_Jurkat without size selection

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: The Nanopore sequencing library was prepared from a single-cell cDNA library using the Ligation Sequencing Kit V9 (#SQK-LSK109, #EXP-NBD104, and #EXP-NBD114, Oxford Nanopore Technologies) following the manufactureru0026#39;s protocol. The sequencing library was then loaded to a MinION flow cell (R9.4.1) (#FLO-MIN106, Oxford Nanopore Technologies) and sequenced on the MinION Mk1B (Oxford Nanopore Technologies) with a sampling rate of 4 kHz. The low-quality reads were filtered using the minimum quality score of 9.

EXPERIMENT.center_name: Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology
EXPERIMENT.TITLE: PromethION single-end Sequencing of Ouro-Seq-applied single-cell cDNA library of mBrain, size selected with CusSolUpTo0.75x

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: The Nanopore sequencing library was prepared from a single-cell cDNA library using the Native Barcoding Kit 24 V14 kit (#SQK-NBD114.24, Oxford Nanopore Technologies) following the manufactureru0026#39;s protocol. The sequencing library was then loaded to a PromethION flow cell (R10.4.1) (# FLO-PRO114M, Oxford Nanopore Technologies) and sequenced on the PromethION 24 (Oxford Nanopore Technologies) with a sampling rate of 5 kHz. The raw sequencing output (FAST5 or POD5) was basecalled with Guppy (version 6.5.7) using the u0026quot;SUPu0026quot; basecalling model (the most accurate and slowest) u0026quot;dna_r10.4.1_e8.2_400bps_5khz_sup.cfgu0026quot;. The low-quality reads were filtered using the minimum quality score of 9. For the construction of the Mouse Single-cell Long-Read Splicing Atlas, the single-cell cDNA libraries from the 22 samples were processed with Ouro-Deplete (for the depletion of cDNAs from mtDNA and rRNA) and subsequently, Ouro-SizeSelect (up to 6 kbp).

EXPERIMENT.center_name: Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology
EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2500 paired-end Sequencing of single-cell RNA-seq library of mBrain

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: First, single-cell suspensions were prepared for 10x Genomics 3u0026#39; v3.1 droplet-based sequencing, targeting recovery of ~8,000 cells (or nuclei); cell (or nucleus) concentration was determined using the Countess II Automated Cell Counter (Thermo Fisher Scientific). The pooled single-cell cDNA library was prepared following the manufactureru0026#39;s protocol (#CG000204 Rev B, 10x Genomics) with a few modifications. First, we increased the incubation time for reverse transcription reaction (GEM-RT reaction) from 45 minutes to 75 minutes to allow the completion of reverse transcription reactions for longer mRNA transcripts. Additionally, for the initial PCR amplification of the cDNA and all subsequent re-amplifications of the resulting cDNA library, the PCR elongation time was extended from 1 minute to 3 minutes to allow amplification of longer cDNA molecules (up to 6 kbp). Next, the short-read scRNA-seq library was prepared using up to half of the amplified cDNA library, strictly following the manufactureru0026#39;s instructions (#CG000204 Rev B, 10x Genomics). The short-read scRNA-seq library was sequenced on a HiSeq platform (Illumina) (28 andu0026thinsp;91 bases for read1 and read2, respectively), targeting 200M reads per sample (u0026gt; 20,000 reads per cell).

The low-quality reads were filtered using the minimum quality score of 9.

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: A single-cell cDNA library was processed with Ouro-Deplete for targeted depletion of cDNAs from mtDNA and rRNA. The Nanopore sequencing library was prepared from the Ouro-Seq-applied single-cell cDNA library using the Native Barcoding Kit 24 V14 kit (#SQK-NBD114.24, Oxford Nanopore Technologies) following the manufactureru0026#39;s protocol. The sequencing library was then loaded to a PromethION flow cell (R10.4.1) (# FLO-PRO114M, Oxford Nanopore Technologies) and sequenced on the PromethION 24 (Oxford Nanopore Technologies) with a sampling rate of 5 kHz. The low-quality reads were filtered using the minimum quality score of 9.

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: The Nanopore sequencing library was prepared from a single-cell cDNA library using the Native Barcoding Kit 24 V14 kit (#SQK-NBD114.24, Oxford Nanopore Technologies) following the manufactureru0026#39;s protocol. The sequencing library was then loaded to a PromethION flow cell (R10.4.1) (# FLO-PRO114M, Oxford Nanopore Technologies) and sequenced on the PromethION 24 (Oxford Nanopore Technologies) with a sampling rate of 5 kHz. The raw sequencing output (FAST5 or POD5) was basecalled with Guppy (version 6.5.7) using the u0026quot;SUPu0026quot; basecalling model (the most accurate and slowest) u0026quot;dna_r10.4.1_e8.2_400bps_5khz_sup.cfgu0026quot;. The low-quality reads were filtered using the minimum quality score of 9. For the construction of the Mouse Single-cell Long-Read Splicing Atlas, the single-cell cDNA libraries from the 22 samples were processed with Ouro-Deplete (for the depletion of cDNAs from mtDNA and rRNA) and subsequently, Ouro-SizeSelect (up to 6 kbp).

EXPERIMENT.center_name: Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology
EXPERIMENT.TITLE: PromethION single-end Sequencing of Ouro-Seq-applied single-cell cDNA library of mBrain Nuclei, size selected with CusSol0.68x

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: The Nanopore sequencing library was prepared from a single-cell cDNA library using the Native Barcoding Kit 24 V14 kit (#SQK-NBD114.24, Oxford Nanopore Technologies) following the manufactureru0026#39;s protocol. The raw sequencing output (FAST5 or POD5) was basecalled with Guppy (version 6.5.7) using the u0026quot;SUPu0026quot; basecalling model (the most accurate and slowest) u0026quot;dna_r10.4.1_e8.2_400bps_5khz_sup.cfgu0026quot;. The low-quality reads were filtered using the minimum quality score of 9. For the construction of the Mouse Single-cell Long-Read Splicing Atlas, the single-cell cDNA libraries from the 22 samples were processed with Ouro-Deplete (for the depletion of cDNAs from mtDNA and rRNA) and subsequently, Ouro-SizeSelect (up to 6 kbp).

EXPERIMENT.center_name: Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology
EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2500 paired-end Sequencing of single-nuclei RNA-seq library of mBrain Nuclei

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: First, single-cell suspensions were prepared for 10x Genomics 3u0026#39; v3.1 droplet-based sequencing, targeting recovery of ~8,000 cells (or nuclei); cell (or nucleus) concentration was determined using the Countess II Automated Cell Counter (Thermo Fisher Scientific). The pooled single-cell cDNA library was prepared following the manufactureru0026#39;s protocol (#CG000204 Rev B, 10x Genomics) with a few modifications. First, we increased the incubation time for reverse transcription reaction (GEM-RT reaction) from 45 minutes to 75 minutes to allow the completion of reverse transcription reactions for longer mRNA transcripts. Additionally, for the initial PCR amplification of the cDNA and all subsequent re-amplifications of the resulting cDNA library, the PCR elongation time was extended from 1 minute to 3 minutes to allow amplification of longer cDNA molecules (up to 6 kbp). Next, the short-read scRNA-seq library was prepared using up to half of the amplified cDNA library, strictly following the manufactureru0026#39;s instructions (#CG000204 Rev B, 10x Genomics). The short-read scRNA-seq library was sequenced on a HiSeq platform (Illumina) (28 andu0026thinsp;91 bases for read1 and read2, respectively), targeting 200M reads per sample (u0026gt; 20,000 reads per cell).

EXPERIMENT.center_name: Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology
EXPERIMENT.TITLE: MinION single-end Sequencing of Ouro-Cell-Enrich-applied (targeting 65 granulocytes and cardiomyocytes among 6,964 cells in total) single-cell cDNA library of mHeart, size selected with BluePippinUpTo2250bpCut

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: The Nanopore sequencing library was prepared from a Ouro-Cell-Enrich-applied single-cell cDNA library using the Ligation Sequencing Kit V9 (#SQK-LSK109, #EXP-NBD104, and #EXP-NBD114, Oxford Nanopore Technologies) following the manufactureru0026#39;s protocol. The sequencing library was then loaded to a MinION flow cell (R9.4.1) (#FLO-MIN106, Oxford Nanopore Technologies) and sequenced on the MinION Mk1B (Oxford Nanopore Technologies) with a sampling rate of 4 kHz. The raw sequencing output (FAST5) was basecalled with Guppy (version 6.5.7) using the u0026quot;SUPu0026quot; basecalling model (the most accurate and slowest) u0026quot;dna_r9.4.1_450bps_sup.cfgu0026quot;. The low-quality reads were filtered using the minimum quality score of 9.

Additionally, for the initial PCR amplification of the cDNA and all subsequent re-amplifications of the resulting cDNA library, the PCR elongation time was extended from 1 minute to 3 minutes to allow amplification of longer cDNA molecules (up to 6 kbp). Next, the short-read scRNA-seq library was prepared using up to half of the amplified cDNA library, strictly following the manufactureru0026#39;s instructions (#CG000204 Rev B, 10x Genomics). The short-read scRNA-seq library was sequenced on a HiSeq platform (Illumina) (28 andu0026thinsp;91 bases for read1 and read2, respectively), targeting 200M reads per sample (u0026gt; 20,000 reads per cell).

EXPERIMENT.center_name: Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology
EXPERIMENT.TITLE: PromethION single-end Sequencing of raw single-cell cDNA library of mHeart Nuclei without size selection

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: The Nanopore sequencing library was prepared from the raw single-cell cDNA library using the Native Barcoding Kit 24 V14 kit (#SQK-NBD114.24, Oxford Nanopore Technologies) following the manufactureru0026#39;s protocol. The sequencing library was then loaded to a PromethION flow cell (R10.4.1) (# FLO-PRO114M, Oxford Nanopore Technologies) and sequenced on the PromethION 24 (Oxford Nanopore Technologies) with a sampling rate of 5 kHz. The raw sequencing output (FAST5 or POD5) was basecalled with Guppy (version 6.5.7) using the u0026quot;SUPu0026quot; basecalling model (the most accurate and slowest) u0026quot;dna_r10.4.1_e8.2_400bps_5khz_sup.cfgu0026quot;. The low-quality reads were filtered using the minimum quality score of 9.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: PromethION single-end Sequencing of Ouro-Seq-applied single-cell cDNA library of mKidney Glomerulus, size selected with CusSol0.68x

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: The Nanopore sequencing library was prepared from a single-cell cDNA library using the Native Barcoding Kit 24 V14 kit (#SQK-NBD114.24, Oxford Nanopore Technologies) following the manufactureru0026#39;s protocol. The sequencing library was then loaded to a PromethION flow cell (R10.4.1) (# FLO-PRO114M, Oxford Nanopore Technologies) and sequenced on the PromethION 24 (Oxford Nanopore Technologies) with a sampling rate of 5 kHz. The raw sequencing output (FAST5 or POD5) was basecalled with Guppy (version 6.5.7) using the u0026quot;SUPu0026quot; basecalling model (the most accurate and slowest) u0026quot;dna_r10.4.1_e8.2_400bps_5khz_sup.cfgu0026quot;. The low-quality reads were filtered using the minimum quality score of 9. For the construction of the Mouse Single-cell Long-Read Splicing Atlas, the single-cell cDNA libraries from the 22 samples were processed with Ouro-Deplete (for the depletion of cDNAs from mtDNA and rRNA) and subsequently, Ouro-SizeSelect (up to 6 kbp).

EXPERIMENT.center_name: Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology
EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2500 paired-end Sequencing of single-cell RNA-seq library of mKidney Glomerulus

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: First, single-cell suspensions were prepared for 10x Genomics 3u0026#39; v3.1 droplet-based sequencing, targeting recovery of ~8,000 cells (or nuclei); cell (or nucleus) concentration was determined using the Countess II Automated Cell Counter (Thermo Fisher Scientific). The pooled single-cell cDNA library was prepared following the manufactureru0026#39;s protocol (#CG000204 Rev B, 10x Genomics) with a few modifications. First, we increased the incubation time for reverse transcription reaction (GEM-RT reaction) from 45 minutes to 75 minutes to allow the completion of reverse transcription reactions for longer mRNA transcripts. Additionally, for the initial PCR amplification of the cDNA and all subsequent re-amplifications of the resulting cDNA library, the PCR elongation time was extended from 1 minute to 3 minutes to allow amplification of longer cDNA molecules (up to 6 kbp). Next, the short-read scRNA-seq library was prepared using up to half of the amplified cDNA library, strictly following the manufactureru0026#39;s instructions (#CG000204 Rev B, 10x Genomics). The short-read scRNA-seq library was sequenced on a HiSeq platform (Illumina) (28 andu0026thinsp;91 bases for read1 and read2, respectively), targeting 200M reads per sample (u0026gt; 20,000 reads per cell).

For the construction of the Mouse Single-cell Long-Read Splicing Atlas, the single-cell cDNA libraries from the 22 samples were processed with Ouro-Deplete (for the depletion of cDNAs from mtDNA and rRNA) and subsequently, Ouro-SizeSelect (up to 6 kbp).

EXPERIMENT.center_name: Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology
EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2500 paired-end Sequencing of single-cell RNA-seq library of mLung

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: First, single-cell suspensions were prepared for 10x Genomics 3u0026#39; v3.1 droplet-based sequencing, targeting recovery of ~8,000 cells (or nuclei); cell (or nucleus) concentration was determined using the Countess II Automated Cell Counter (Thermo Fisher Scientific). The pooled single-cell cDNA library was prepared following the manufactureru0026#39;s protocol (#CG000204 Rev B, 10x Genomics) with a few modifications. First, we increased the incubation time for reverse transcription reaction (GEM-RT reaction) from 45 minutes to 75 minutes to allow the completion of reverse transcription reactions for longer mRNA transcripts. Additionally, for the initial PCR amplification of the cDNA and all subsequent re-amplifications of the resulting cDNA library, the PCR elongation time was extended from 1 minute to 3 minutes to allow amplification of longer cDNA molecules (up to 6 kbp). Next, the short-read scRNA-seq library was prepared using up to half of the amplified cDNA library, strictly following the manufactureru0026#39;s instructions (#CG000204 Rev B, 10x Genomics). The short-read scRNA-seq library was sequenced on a HiSeq platform (Illumina) (28 andu0026thinsp;91 bases for read1 and read2, respectively), targeting 200M reads per sample (u0026gt; 20,000 reads per cell).

EXPERIMENT.center_name: Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology
EXPERIMENT.TITLE: PromethION single-end Sequencing of Ouro-Seq-applied single-cell cDNA library of mLung2, size selected with CusSolUpTo0.75x

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: The Nanopore sequencing library was prepared from a single-cell cDNA library using the Native Barcoding Kit 24 V14 kit (#SQK-NBD114.24, Oxford Nanopore Technologies) following the manufactureru0026#39;s protocol. The sequencing library was then loaded to a PromethION flow cell (R10.4.1) (# FLO-PRO114M, Oxford Nanopore Technologies) and sequenced on the PromethION 24 (Oxford Nanopore Technologies) with a sampling rate of 5 kHz. The raw sequencing output (FAST5 or POD5) was basecalled with Guppy (version 6.5.7) using the u0026quot;SUPu0026quot; basecalling model (the most accurate and slowest) u0026quot;dna_r10.4.1_e8.2_400bps_5khz_sup.cfgu0026quot;. The low-quality reads were filtered using the minimum quality score of 9. For the construction of the Mouse Single-cell Long-Read Splicing Atlas, the single-cell cDNA libraries from the 22 samples were processed with Ouro-Deplete (for the depletion of cDNAs from mtDNA and rRNA) and subsequently, Ouro-SizeSelect (up to 6 kbp).

The sequencing library was then loaded to a PromethION flow cell (R10.4.1) (# FLO-PRO114M, Oxford Nanopore Technologies) and sequenced on the PromethION 24 (Oxford Nanopore Technologies) with a sampling rate of 5 kHz. The raw sequencing output (FAST5 or POD5) was basecalled with Guppy (version 6.5.7) using the u0026quot;SUPu0026quot; basecalling model (the most accurate and slowest) u0026quot;dna_r10.4.1_e8.2_400bps_5khz_sup.cfgu0026quot;. The low-quality reads were filtered using the minimum quality score of 9. For the construction of the Mouse Single-cell Long-Read Splicing Atlas, the single-cell cDNA libraries from the 22 samples were processed with Ouro-Deplete (for the depletion of cDNAs from mtDNA and rRNA) and subsequently, Ouro-SizeSelect (up to 6 kbp).

EXPERIMENT.center_name: Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology
EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2500 paired-end Sequencing of single-cell RNA-seq library of mPBMC

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: First, single-cell suspensions were prepared for 10x Genomics 3u0026#39; v3.1 droplet-based sequencing, targeting recovery of ~8,000 cells (or nuclei); cell (or nucleus) concentration was determined using the Countess II Automated Cell Counter (Thermo Fisher Scientific). The pooled single-cell cDNA library was prepared following the manufactureru0026#39;s protocol (#CG000204 Rev B, 10x Genomics) with a few modifications. First, we increased the incubation time for reverse transcription reaction (GEM-RT reaction) from 45 minutes to 75 minutes to allow the completion of reverse transcription reactions for longer mRNA transcripts. Additionally, for the initial PCR amplification of the cDNA and all subsequent re-amplifications of the resulting cDNA library, the PCR elongation time was extended from 1 minute to 3 minutes to allow amplification of longer cDNA molecules (up to 6 kbp). Next, the short-read scRNA-seq library was prepared using up to half of the amplified cDNA library, strictly following the manufactureru0026#39;s instructions (#CG000204 Rev B, 10x Genomics). The short-read scRNA-seq library was sequenced on a HiSeq platform (Illumina) (28 andu0026thinsp;91 bases for read1 and read2, respectively), targeting 200M reads per sample (u0026gt; 20,000 reads per cell).

For the construction of the Mouse Single-cell Long-Read Splicing Atlas, the single-cell cDNA libraries from the 22 samples were processed with Ouro-Deplete (for the depletion of cDNAs from mtDNA and rRNA) and subsequently, Ouro-SizeSelect (up to 6 kbp).

EXPERIMENT.center_name: Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology
EXPERIMENT.TITLE: PromethION single-end Sequencing of Ouro-Seq-applied single-cell cDNA library of mThymus, size selected with CusSol0.75to0.68x

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: The Nanopore sequencing library was prepared from a single-cell cDNA library using the Native Barcoding Kit 24 V14 kit (#SQK-NBD114.24, Oxford Nanopore Technologies) following the manufactureru0026#39;s protocol. The sequencing library was then loaded to a PromethION flow cell (R10.4.1) (# FLO-PRO114M, Oxford Nanopore Technologies) and sequenced on the PromethION 24 (Oxford Nanopore Technologies) with a sampling rate of 5 kHz. The raw sequencing output (FAST5 or POD5) was basecalled with Guppy (version 6.5.7) using the u0026quot;SUPu0026quot; basecalling model (the most accurate and slowest) u0026quot;dna_r10.4.1_e8.2_400bps_5khz_sup.cfgu0026quot;. The low-quality reads were filtered using the minimum quality score of 9. For the construction of the Mouse Single-cell Long-Read Splicing Atlas, the single-cell cDNA libraries from the 22 samples were processed with Ouro-Deplete (for the depletion of cDNAs from mtDNA and rRNA) and subsequently, Ouro-SizeSelect (up to 6 kbp).

EXPERIMENT.center_name: Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology
EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2500 paired-end Sequencing of single-cell RNA-seq library of mThymus

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: First, single-cell suspensions were prepared for 10x Genomics 3u0026#39; v3.1 droplet-based sequencing, targeting recovery of ~8,000 cells (or nuclei); cell (or nucleus) concentration was determined using the Countess II Automated Cell Counter (Thermo Fisher Scientific). The pooled single-cell cDNA library was prepared following the manufactureru0026#39;s protocol (#CG000204 Rev B, 10x Genomics) with a few modifications. First, we increased the incubation time for reverse transcription reaction (GEM-RT reaction) from 45 minutes to 75 minutes to allow the completion of reverse transcription reactions for longer mRNA transcripts. Additionally, for the initial PCR amplification of the cDNA and all subsequent re-amplifications of the resulting cDNA library, the PCR elongation time was extended from 1 minute to 3 minutes to allow amplification of longer cDNA molecules (up to 6 kbp). Next, the short-read scRNA-seq library was prepared using up to half of the amplified cDNA library, strictly following the manufactureru0026#39;s instructions (#CG000204 Rev B, 10x Genomics). The short-read scRNA-seq library was sequenced on a HiSeq platform (Illumina) (28 andu0026thinsp;91 bases for read1 and read2, respectively), targeting 200M reads per sample (u0026gt; 20,000 reads per cell).

EXPERIMENT.center_name: Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology
EXPERIMENT.TITLE: MinION single-end Sequencing of raw single-cell cDNA library of mThymus without size selection

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: The Nanopore sequencing library was prepared from a single-cell cDNA library using the Ligation Sequencing Kit V9 (#SQK-LSK109, #EXP-NBD104, and #EXP-NBD114, Oxford Nanopore Technologies) following the manufactureru0026#39;s protocol. The sequencing library was then loaded to a MinION flow cell (R9.4.1) (#FLO-MIN106, Oxford Nanopore Technologies) and sequenced on the MinION Mk1B (Oxford Nanopore Technologies) with a sampling rate of 4 kHz. The raw sequencing output (FAST5) was basecalled with Guppy (version 6.5.7) using the u0026quot;SUPu0026quot; basecalling model (the most accurate and slowest) u0026quot;dna_r9.4.1_450bps_sup.cfgu0026quot;. The low-quality reads were filtered using the minimum quality score of 9.

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: The total genomic DNA was extracted using the CTAB method. A genomic library with an insertion size of 151 bp was constructed, and two libraries were created using a single digestion with the u0026#39;ApeK1u0026#39; enzyme. Raw sequence reads were generated using the Illumina HiSeq X Ten platform.
